metadata.Title: CVE-2023-25775 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Improper access control in the Intel(R) Ethernet Controller RDMA driver for linux before version 1.9.30 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via network access. Ivan D Barrera, Christopher Bednarz, Mustafa Ismail, and Shiraz Saleem discovered that the InfiniBand RDMA driver in the Linux kernel did not properly check for zero-length STAG or MR registration. A remote attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Ivan D Barrera, Christopher Bednarz, Mustafa Ismail, and Shiraz Saleem

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
